elements.2211.03099_68f927c664fb5abc15b234bf0b61f: We describe improvements to the quasicentroid molecular dynamics (QCMD) path-integral method, which was developed recently for computing the infrared spectra of condensed-phase systems
elements.2211.03099_2b53963490cb6c851b44222d9e1f5: The main development is an improved estimator for the intermolecular torque on the quasicentroid
elements.2211.03099_df9896e942cf25feb4bb74d459309: liquid water and ice, the new estimator is found to remove an artificial
elements.2211.03099_c9d05a485c001f179df8afc304c33: red shift from the libration bands, to increase slightly the intensity of the OH stretch band in the liquid, and to reduce small errors noted previously in the QCMD radial distribution functions
elements.2211.03099_abb13728eb6d0d4d65755deb50b37: We also modify the mass-scaling used in the adiabatic QCMD algorithm, which allows the molecular dynamics timestep to be quadrupled, thus reducing the expense of a QCMD calculation to twice that of Cartesian centroid molecular dynamics for
elements.2211.03099_c44ae78cc18a87b85b540b9227f7d: liquid water at 300 K, and eight times for ice at 150 K.
elements.2211.03099_48fec2c6de69cf78dc05285d9f8ff: Quasicentroid molecular dynamics (QCMD) is a recently developed path-integral dynamics method
elements.2211.03099_65e721a79268cfb2fbd9eda9097e0: which has given promising results for simulations of infrared spectra in gas and condensed phases.
elements.2211.03099_8fa524add2dcedb5da8b8dc6f959f: It avoids most of the well-characterised drawbacks
elements.2211.03099_9703314aeb03bd03420a1f9ae42c4: of the related centroid molecular dynamics (CMD)
elements.2211.03099_8a031cd7a0680fd1a8aa353600833: methods, by propagating classical trajectories on the potential of mean force (PMF) obtained by constraining a set of curvilinear centroids
elements.2211.03099_552623e00b58a927e518656b50c2f: These coordinates are system-dependent and chosen to give compact ring-polymer distributions in which the curvilinear centroid lies close to the Cartesian centroid and is hence referred to as the `quasicentroid'
elements.2211.03099_3826c998efce845223ba6d18daa3b: As originally developed, QCMD uses a modification
elements.2211.03099_fcf05cb21d80bd077d82f1815c165: which makes QCMD more expensive than CMD (e.g., by a factor of 32 for
elements.2211.03099_c09097e1b905b076669cce454ca01: K), and thus much more expensive than
elements.2211.03099_fae8263f28f0b54f60807dae50869: However, exciting recent progress has been made in developing a fast QCMD (f-QCMD) algorithm,
elements.2211.03099_647dde10b47de03d38766166f164b: which extracts a highly accurate approximation to the quasicentroid PMF from a static path-integral calculation.
elements.2211.03099_08ea257b79c9d2e9855b8c7b088eb: In the gas-phase, QCMD has now been applied to water, ammonia and methane (the latter using f-QCMD).
elements.2211.03099_9fd6fa49fa1c45fa4a070d15113fe: The positions and intensities of the fundamental bands are in excellent agreement with the exact quantum results, and the positions of the overtone and combination bands are in reasonable agreement
elements.2211.03099_3243ff76a344b25ca78d246ff0bf2: However, the intensities of the latter are an order of magnitude too small, which was shown recently
elements.2211.03099_4c6de3861f282cb6ab0246e258d7e: to be because QCMD neglects coupling between the Matsubara dynamics
elements.2211.03099_94c1acb5594c12ce037eec96eef9e: of the centroid and the fluctuation modes [as also do CMD, RPMD and classical molecular dynamics (MD)].
elements.2211.03099_d4f515e08b5d4ef993cd63a461185: In the condensed phase, QCMD has been tested on the
elements.2211.03099_361b5907ed2e52e83665fbd408ffb: water model, for the liquid at 300 K and for ice I
elements.2211.03099_e1e104b418d7bec713a73822031d2: Detailed comparisons with experiment are not possible for such a simple potential,
elements.2211.03099_5f9313baf07afd97741805649f6b4: but the QCMD results are promising: the spectra appear to inherit the advantages of the gas-phase QCMD calculations, with the stretch bands showing none of the artefacts that appear in the corresponding CMD and (T)RPMD spectra at low temperatures
elements.2211.03099_56c891b971997f494be37494970a8: and lining up well with the results of other simulation methods.
elements.2211.03099_85af25b2dd3b8ed128d5cf607da20: However, QCMD does appear to have introduced a minor artefact of its own into the
elements.2211.03099_db3987205908c5b564232899745fc: spectra, in the form of a 25 cm
elements.2211.03099_51dc93b6d6691856793377ff46ca1: red shift in the libration bands of both the liquid and ice.
elements.2211.03099_4773b5f0579e470c56a8712a78b66: This is a numerically small error, but it might become larger in other condensed-phase calculations, because it is most likely caused by errors in the estimator for the intermolecular torque
elements.2211.03099_7590a53546fd73d7e737ec58f53e3: (between the quasicentroids of pairs of monomers)
elements.2211.03099_cc4a959279170af484afcee0a418d: Unlike the other components of the PMF,
elements.2211.03099_51e748588f7259b2461a425632854: needed to be approximated in order to make the simulations practical, and the ad hoc assumption was made
elements.2211.03099_e4d4f8e627897ed7bbac83d3c0b92: could be approximated as the average of the torques on the individual ring-polymer beads
elements.2211.03099_a6397479239139379f762b2fef20f: Here, we introduce a new estimator for
elements.2211.03099_1eff4676d4ee25dfc99feca3e7e79: and report numerical tests which show that it removes the 25 cm
elements.2211.03099_e2c9bcb6f7f9ae62d9ddadedc482a: libration bands, increases slightly the intensity of the stretch band in the liquid, and reduces small errors in the radial distribution functions (noted in previous QCMD calculations at 300
elements.2211.03099_a68132e6a13b8c31255b2e30d61cf: After summarising the theory of QCMD in
elements.2211.03099_2416b629e557dd1171e29ba9d584f: ) introduce a straightforward modification to the adiabatic QCMD propagator which improves numerical stability and speeds up the calculation by a factor of four.
elements.2211.03099_9a33292a9aa6348293c6d9cd86011: In QCMD, the dynamics are approximated by classical trajectories on a quantum potential of mean force, which is obtained by sampling the quantum Boltzmann distribution as a function of a set of curvilinear centroid coordinates
elements.2211.03099_4ec2b27b5e9a74ed27bdfe12bdbf6: are used to represent the distribution
elements.2211.03099_b264f854530f68dfd8154e2e1a07c: For a gas-phase system, the distribution takes the form
elements.2211.03099_d6b3cc293be805286f5b41235a8af: The curvilinear centroid coordinates are system-dependent and are chosen to make the distribution compact, such that the molecular geometry specified by the curvilinear centroids, called the `quasicentroid', is close to the geometry specified by the (Cartesian) centroids of the atoms (i.e., the centres of mass of
elements.2211.03099_47cc6b165b1ad089278cba8abd631: For example, a good set of curvilinear centroids for gas-phase water are the bond-angle centroids
elements.2211.03099_09ee5840c2c0049aafdb6fdc32916: are the bond-angle coordinates of the individual beads
elements.2211.03099_5d9275fafa0885bc9f6d14561da7a: To generate the dynamics, the quasicentroid coordinates are converted to a set of cartesians,
elements.2211.03099_a769db6c05cc14c1eb0032b5e231b: using standard Cartesian classical dynamics, with the forces generated by the PMF
elements.2211.03099_c6401775162bf4d334eebe803d4f3: denotes a quasicentroid-constrained average over the ring-polymer distribution
elements.2211.03099_fdc4ece8a8fa028b9809433781e69: The trajectories are thermostatted, which ensures that they sample a good approximation to the exact quantum Boltzmann distribution, provided the quasicentroid-constrained distributions are sufficiently compact (which should always be checked numerically by comparing static thermal averages computed using QCMD and standard path-integral methods)
elements.2211.03099_a5d5c32552c3a243e7a5a6c6ef864: For a condensed-phase system, the ring-polymer distribution of
elements.2211.03099_7663487e03a6ca990872bbd10a35c: generalises in the usual way, to include a sum over all the molecules in the simulation cell, together with intermolecular components of the physical potential
elements.2211.03099_20229c3c0912c6449938b7ac994c7: to handle the periodic boundary conditions)
elements.2211.03099_55f69123fde4a71eb8eb6376ea5cd: in the case of water), one must also define

elements.2211.03099_6f1209ad3b9fe85dbcdce86e2cfc9: This is done by applying to the quasicentroids of each molecule the `Eckart-like' conditions,
elements.2211.03099_1c9963f37dff126c7c8af042c37be: where the sum is over the atoms in the molecule, and
elements.2211.03099_be29b75e6dac53b875f2c9c79ea04: are the Cartesian centroids of atom

elements.2211.03099_457b8b43722763ded37c236362633: ) orients the atomic quasicentroids so as to minimise the mass-weighted sum of their square distances from the atomic quasicentroids

elements.2211.03099_4e6158003ec0f2ef4233c266a686f: Tests for liquid water and ice
elements.2211.03099_e2b5f44d30c28bd36ca7a6ba86fad: infrared spectra of liquid water (300 K) and ice I
elements.2211.03099_3705412dda7f21f4feff9480e3528: (150 K) using the adiabatic QCMD (AQCMD) algorithm of
elements.2211.03099_9d6ac36d26f7132b38b576f5300b5: We also took the opportunity to improve the efficiency and stability of the algorithm, by modifying the mass scaling.
elements.2211.03099_65483894f6f5df601ed66849e620d: The AQCMD algorithm is a modification of the ACMD algorithm.
elements.2211.03099_452bf8c0eab038906a2a755483358: The latter samples the (Cartesian) centroid-constrained ring-polymer distribution adiabatically, on the fly, by scaling the masses of the ring-polymer normal modes orthogonal to the centroid (to increase their vibrational frequencies) and thermostatting them aggressively
elements.2211.03099_2f19e4ad66b55c348ef851b74ad69: AQCMD applies the analogous procedure to generate the PMF of the quasicentroid on the fly
elements.2211.03099_f11884cd2baacc451eff1739c1cd5: It achieves this by mass-scaling all ring-polymer degrees of freedom (including the Cartesian centroids) and by applying quasicentroid constraints to the thermostatted ring-polymer dynamics
elements.2211.03099_4c5bf7b7c67eea2100a6e515fd91c: The resulting AQCMD algorithm resembles the dynamics of two different systems (the ring-polymer beads and the quasicentroids) evolving in parallel
elements.2211.03099_5c0be59ffcdc0838091bb0d4d0c5b: The original version of ACMD scaled the masses
elements.2211.03099_5fcbb18d384702b6df0b9c4ac565a: associated with the ring-polymer normal modes orthogonal to the centroid (
elements.2211.03099_f4c7196f909fc62183688cf4415e9: is the ring-polymer-spring frequency of mode
elements.2211.03099_89d928c891a20ae7e645a85830c38: corresponds to complete adiabatic separation between the dynamics of the centroid and the non-centroid modes, but in practice
elements.2211.03099_d87ca6a509e9a25ff0f652f0543a4: as small as possible in order to use the largest possible timestep
elements.2211.03099_86520b85b578ed9d8719270de6c62: modes, and additionally scaled the centroid (
elements.2211.03099_854286593ba5d4f94b236b235c2fa: The problem with this choice of scaling (for both ACMD and AQCMD) is that it does not scale the frequencies of different normal modes evenly
elements.2211.03099_454f4cebe5b17115c10ccadd77d6e: (roughly the libration frequency of water), but that it has a spike at low
elements.2211.03099_377ae0d8a550df080f9ee1b3f5644: becomes larger than numerically necessary for low
elements.2211.03099_89b64e8409a0a84432adfa97490b3: , resulting in the need for a particularly small timestep
elements.2211.03099_05a08154f2430c598b06fbc2c5e4d: scaling of the centroid shifts the frequency of this mode significantly less than that of the other modes
elements.2211.03099_3d9b6aa7306e839ea7e13c16eda56: We thus use a new mass-scaling similar to that employed in the i-PI package
elements.2211.03099_5ff1a4e554758f70e11841cde74dd: is a much flatter function of
elements.2211.03099_fda18392dbc69dc05011c9370c1ba: and can thus be expected to allow larger timesteps for a given choice of

elements.2211.03099_b85406623d17a5d4b0bddecb987c8: The IR absorption spectra were calculated from the average quasicentroid dipole-derivative time-correlation function, following Appendix
elements.2211.03099_f279aeb1b6516126f51a0da9688d9: shows that use of the new

elements.2211.03099_9bbfb6368508961d58f826276c0fa: red shift from the QCMD libration bands at both temperatures, which now overlap almost exactly with CMD
elements.2211.03099_40fab45b6220b4f0a313b893490cb: At higher frequencies the original and revised QCMD spectra are identical to within statistical uncertainty, except for the intensity of the OH stretch (
elements.2211.03099_ea00e4e69b58e952e15a19175cf91: K, which has increased slightly in the revised spectrum; this brings the intensity ratio of the HOH bend and the OH stretch more in line with those observed in classical MD and CMD calculations at the same temperature.
elements.2211.03099_aa81c3b6f13d34ce2977e47ef544b: For these reasons, we believe that the new
elements.2211.03099_cf37b52cbcfc40e16afd52eeb23f0: estimator gives a better approximation to the exact torque on the molecule quasicentroids than the old estimator of Ref.
elements.2211.03099_9b3adddc72ec8aeb71254097001a1: To consolidate this last statement, we also extracted the (static) O
elements.2211.03099_c11d3240561d69e7a9af02f10eb60: O radial distribution functions (RDFs) from the QCMD calculations at
elements.2211.03099_1c293e7061f64df6f40e4dba80d6d: , and compared them with those computed using the old estimator of Ref.
elements.2211.03099_451f9f94fbfec754ad05e35472f26: Pleasingly, the new estimator reduces the small errors in the radial distribution functions, which now follow the PIMD results very closely
elements.2211.03099_f54bac4928ddd87b5fc646f0cea68: More broadly, these RDF results show that purely static properties are sufficiently sensitive to the torque estimators that they can be used to verify (independently of the heuristic derivation of
elements.2211.03099_2a77b650c3a1a95ed2ffcfed0fc26: ) which estimator gives a better description of the torque on the quasicentroids
elements.2211.03099_292a9ea56ea6c1ef7b2ba8e8ce56c: This property should be useful when extending QCMD to treat condensed-phase systems other than pure water.
elements.2211.03099_43316990f3029997bf998612376fd: , which use the old estimator for
elements.2211.03099_bc15f8e89e324a45612ada6b607cb: , have already given very promising results, yielding infrared spectra for
elements.2211.03099_0a8b47c5300bb556f6b00d2cb8b28: water and ice which eliminate most of the artefacts in the stretch region associated with CMD and (T)RPMD
elements.2211.03099_9731eb25ccab9b60959d33f8a9037: However, it is reassuring that the one minor anomaly in these spectra, namely the 25 cm
elements.2211.03099_ed2e938d5531cbafe70c858c0b0ed: red shift of the librational bands, is removed by using the improved estimator presented here, bringing this (essentially classical) region of the spectrum in line with the results of CMD, (T)RPMD and classical MD calculations
elements.2211.03099_32511506ac4a51ff4eb3755c19329: It is also useful that we have been able to speed up the AQCMD algorithm by a factor of four using the modified `i-PI' mass scaling of
elements.2211.03099_6e8989247f3e74f333cbbe4059c11: However, even with this gain in efficiency, AQCMD remains very costly: it is twice as expensive as adiabatic CMD for
elements.2211.03099_af5a2ca0251ba1a20f75cb4f607ef: liquid water at 300 K and eight times for ice at 150 K. Another drawback of QCMD is that it requires the internal quasicentroid coordinates to be tailored to each system and is thus tricky to generalise
elements.2211.03099_2a1e27060f62118924873b66a0543: Nevertheless, recent developments, especially of the fast QCMD method (f-QCMD),
elements.2211.03099_3272f40be3809fb6c17fadbb8095d: suggest that QCMD is likely to become a powerful method for computing infrared spectra in the condensed phase, provided the dynamics do not involve strongly anharmonic `floppy' motion such as in protonated water clusters.
elements.2211.03099_13309a2f3485380f2089ab5200aea: We hope that the calculations presented here will serve as useful benchmarks for these and related
